Description.DefaultValue: Adds command buttons to the ribbon in Outlook

bt:String.DefaultValue: Enter your own text to insert
Gets the subject of the message or appointment
Inserts text into body of the message or appointment. This is an example of a function button.
Inserts your choice of text into body of the message or appointment. This is an example of a drop-down menu button.
Opens a pane where you can enter text to insert in the body of the message or appointment. This is an example of a button that opens a task pane.
Inserts Hello World! into the body of the message or appointment.
Inserts Add-in commands are cool! into the body of the message or appointment.
Inserts Visit Outlook Dev Center into the body of the message or appointment.
Gets the subject of the message or appointment and displays it in the info bar. This is an example of a function button.
Gets the selected property of the message or appointment and displays it in the info bar. This is an example of a drop-down menu button.
Opens a pane displaying all available properties of the message or appointment. This is an example of a button that opens a task pane.
Gets the item class of the message or appointment and displays it in the info bar.
Gets the date and time the message or appointment was created and displays it in the info bar.
Gets the item ID of the message or appointment and displays it in the info bar.
Enter your own text to insert
Gets the subject of the message or appointment
Inserts text into body of the message or appointment. This is an example of a function button.
Inserts your choice of text into body of the message or appointment. This is an example of a drop-down menu button.
Opens a pane where you can enter text to insert in the body of the message or appointment. This is an example of a button that opens a task pane.
Inserts Hello World! into the body of the message or appointment.
Inserts Add-in commands are cool! into the body of the message or appointment.
Inserts Visit Outlook Dev Center into the body of the message or appointment.
Gets the subject of the message or appointment and displays it in the info bar. This is an example of a function button.
Gets the selected property of the message or appointment and displays it in the info bar. This is an example of a drop-down menu button.
Opens a pane displaying all available properties of the message or appointment. This is an example of a button that opens a task pane.
Opens a pane allowing you to test various REST API calls using the access token returned by the server.
Gets the item class of the message or appointment and displays it in the info bar.
Gets the date and time the message or appointment was created and displays it in the info bar.
Gets the item ID of the message or appointment and displays it in the info bar.
